item.title: By: Jon Baker
item.dc:creator: Jon Baker
item.description: Maybe it's just because I'm not an academic, maybe it's a US vs Israel difference, but I thought a lamdan was a teacher, while "lomdus" was erudition, as in a "lomdish drosha." I see a title like this, and I think it's about history of education, teaching styles, social standing of teachers, etc.
item.content:encoded: Maybe it’s just because I’m not an academic, maybe it’s a US vs Israel difference, but I thought a lamdan was a teacher, while “lomdus” was erudition, as in a “lomdish drosha.” I see a title like this, and I think it’s about history of education, teaching styles, social standing of teachers, etc.
